overview_of_class:
RTVF 360 - 0, Section 26: Writing the Coming-of-Age Story
Tuesdays, 3:00 - 5:50
Instructor: Rebecca Gilman

Enrollment:  Prerequisite: RTVF 260 Foundations of Screenwriting or permission of the instructor.  Enrollment is limited to 12 students.

Contact info: r-gilman@northwestern.edu

Description:  This intensive writing class will explore the genre of the coming-of-age story in its many variations, including teen comedies, sexual awakening narratives, tales of arrested development, and nostalgic coming-of-age dramas. We will look at examples from the media of film, TV, and stage. Then we will examine the genre in the context of its mythical origins in the hopes of discovering a narrative formula that might be followed in any iteration.

Readings, lectures, discussion, screenings, and short writing assignments will lead to the development of a final project: the first 30 pages and a complete outline of a full-length screenplay, television pilot, or play.

All films will be shown in class or available for viewing online via CANVAS.

Required texts:
Mr. Marmalade, by Noah Haidle
The Aliens, by Annie Baker
